alert.note: Alert for Greer; Harmon; Jackson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 5:11PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jackson, Harmon, south central Greer, Foard, Knox, Wilbarger, Baylor and Hardeman Counties through 600 PM CST... At 509 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from 6 miles south of Kirkland to near O`brien. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. Strong to possibly damaging wind gusts and blowing dirt are possible as these showers move into southwest Oklahoma and western north Texas. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dirt will reduce visibility for motorists. Locations impacted include... Altus, Vernon, Mangum, Seymour, Quanah, Hollis, Munday, Knox City, Crowell, Benjamin, Chillicothe, Olustee, Eldorado, Goree, Martha, Gould, Elmer, Westover, Bomarton and Margaret. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
